nodes.title: Grade Appeal Response
nodes.prompt: A student emails to argue for points back on an assignment. Draft your reply as the professor.

rubric.context: Evaluate professor replies to a student requesting a grade change. Tone should be professional, fair, and constructive. Don't be too stingy, if a response is mostly correct (aka would fit into a positive bucket), put it in that bucket and highlight what could be changed. We aren't looking for perfection, just good grouping.

answerBuckets.classifier: Perfect. Clear, professional, empathetic. Explains grading criteria, references rubric, offers regrade/next steps without promising an unwarranted change.
Good. Clear, professional, empathetic. Cites what is specifically wrong and tells the student what will happen moving forward.
Middling. Polite but thin: acknowledges request but lacks detail
Bad. Defensive or dismissive; gives no rationale or next steps; unprofessional tone.
